intro: Hieracium venosum var. retusum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy stems and serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in woodland edges.
